metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2690 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
virt-edit in libguestfs before 1.18.0 does not preserve the permissions from the original file and saves the new file with world-readable permissions when editing, which might allow local guest users to obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang-guestfs - 1:1.18.1-1
gir1.2-guestfs-1.0 - 1:1.18.1-1
guestfsd - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-gfs2 - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-gobject-1.0-0 - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-hfsplus - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-java - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-jfs - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-nilfs - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-ocaml - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-perl - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-reiserfs - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-rescue - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-rsync - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-tools - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-xfs - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs-zfs - 1:1.18.1-1
libguestfs0 - 1:1.18.1-1
lua-guestfs - 1:1.18.1-1
python-guestfs - 1:1.18.1-1
python3-guestfs - 1:1.18.1-1
ruby-guestfs - 1:1.18.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libguestfs package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.18.1-1').
